title: Euro to U.S. dollar annual average exchange rate 1999 to 2019
summary: This line chart has an x axis representing Year and a y axis representing Exchange rate, with a total of 21 data points. The chart has 5 significant trends.
The longest trend is moderately positive which exists from 2010 to 2005.
Likewise, the next significant trend is extremely positive which exists from 2005 to 2001.
Similarly, the next significant trend is moderately positive which exists from 2019 to 2016.
Additionally, the next significant trend is slightly neutral which exists from 2016 to 2013.
Additionally, the next significant trend is moderately positive which exists from 2013 to 2010.
gold: This statistic displays the annual exchange rate ( average or standardized measure ) of the euro to the U.S. dollar ( EUR USD ) , according to the data from the European Central Bank , which cover the period from the introduction of the euro in 1999 up until 2019 . The average ( standardized ) measure is based on the calculation of many observations throughout the period in question . It is therefore different than an annual measure at point in time , which reflects concrete values as of end of the year .
